pgTitle: List of museums in North Dakota

rows.text: Includes over 40 buildings on 12 acres (49,000 m2), historic aircraft, automobiles, horse-drawn vehicles, farm equipment, museums on law enforcement, medicine, telephones, firefighting, and period stores and houses
website, includes a homesteader's log cabin, dentist's office, photograph gallery, library, and the original Stevens country school
History of the mid 19th century infantry post, also local history
Operated by the Cavalier County Historical Society
Chateau de Mores State Historic Site
Fossils and dinosaur replicas, rocks, minerals and meteorites
Civilian and military aircraft, photos and memorabilia
Includes Joachim Regional Museum with local history and art exhibits, Pioneer Machinery Museum, and the open air Prairie Outpost Park with historic village buildings
Pioneer village including two churches, a schoolhouse, print shop, general store, sawmill, blacksmith shop, baker, and a bank
website, themes include American Indian, Western, farm machinery, religious, military, children's artifacts, household items, clothing, photographs and furniture
information, includes school, church and depot with historic furnishings and exhibits
Includes visitor center exhibits about the fort and Mandan tribe, On-A-Slant Indian Village, 1870s period Custer House
website, information, includes artifacts from archaeological digs at the site of the fort
Restored fort and Lake Region Pioneer Daughters Museum
Fort Union Trading Post National Historic Site
Fur trading post with seasonal living history presentations
information, wildlife mounts, American Indian exhibits, agricultural artifacts, local and regional history
Gingras Trading Post State Historic Site
Mid-19th century fur trading post and house
website, information, antique tractors, farm equipment and implements
Knife River Indian Villages National Historic Site
Includes museum, sites of Northern Plains Indians villages, reconstructed earth lodge
website, information, also known as the Old Post Office Museum

information, open by appointment, pioneer village, and transportation and farm equipment, including steam engines, kerosene and gasoline tractors, crawlers, road building equipment, wagons, sawmill, farm equipment, stationary engines, cars, trucks, and firefighting equipment
website, includes local history museum in a church, one room schoolhouse, depot, homestead house, fire hall, farm machinery
End-of-the-line turn-around railroad loop, train rides and museum
website, complex includes main museum with local history, natural history and culture exhibits, original museum with period room and business displays, a schoolhouse, cabin and Sioux ferry boat
website, cultural and historical significance of the North American bison
North Dakota Cowboy Hall of Fame
North Dakota Lewis and Clark Interpretive Center
Lewis and Clark Expedition in the state, area fur trade and agriculture
Ox Cart Trails Historical Society Museum
Collections include contemporary, Native American and folk art

website, includes pioneer village, classic cars, antique tools, farm equipment and implements, antique guns, household items, Native American and Eskimo artifacts, wildlife displays, Scandinavian heritage exhibit
website, website, includes flour mill, historic house, one room schoolhouse, pioneer dam, local history and period room displays
information, exhibits include musical instruments, pioneer artifacts and African artifacts
information, photos, information, scroll to listing
Ronald Reagan Minuteman Missile State Historic Site
information, Friends of Oscar-Zero, information, includes control center and silo, opening 2009
website, information, tourist center that includes local and railroad exhibits
website, replica buildings and exhibits about Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Finland, and Iceland
information, 1907 period house, open by appointment
Formerly known as the Minot Art Gallery, area visual art
information, includes 1897 period Plummer House, log cabin, two buildings with military, school, pioneer and agriculture collections
Turtle Mountain Chippewa Indian Heritage Center
information, antiques and period displays, open by appointment
